meanings.definition: A curved blade or sword used by ancient Roman soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The warrior wielded the falx with skill in battle.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an ancient falx from the Roman era.
meanings.sent3: The falx was so sharp that it could slice through armor easily.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a falx, cutting through the lies to reveal the truth.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming falx gleamed in the sunlight, a deadly beauty.

meanings.definition: A bony process on the inner side of the occipital bone of the skull.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the falx on the X-ray of the skull.
meanings.sent2: The falx helps protect the brain from impacts to the head.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his falx was his built-in helmet.
meanings.sent4: The falx stood like a guardian, shielding the brain from harm.
meanings.sent5: The falx curved inward, cradling the delicate brain within.

meanings.definition: A sickle-shaped structure in the brain.
meanings.sent1: The falx separates the two hemispheres of the brain.
meanings.sent2: The falx plays a crucial role in brain function.
meanings.sent3: She imagined tiny workers using the falx to harvest thoughts.
meanings.sent4: His creativity flowed freely across the falx, connecting ideas.
meanings.sent5: The falx danced in her mind, shaping her dreams and memories.
